head.title: Learning to Disagree At the Catholic Worker

hedline.hl1: Learning to Disagree At the Catholic Worker

abstract.p: Sheri Clemons letter on August 13 article recalls living in New York Catholic Worker community (S)

block.p: Re ''The Givers'' (Aug. 13): I was a member of the New York Catholic Worker community from 1983 to 1987. Although challenging and a bit frightening at times, living there was one of the most enriching opportunities of my life (I am now a social worker). I was never a model Catholic Worker. While living there I came out as a lesbian and temped at major corporations to supplement my ''ice cream money.'' Living at the Worker helped me learn how to live well with those in my community with whom I disagreed.
